elements.text: PART ONE
1. INT. HUMAN ESCORT SHIP (COCKPIT
FX: CACOPHONY OF STATIC, EXPLOSIONS AND SCREAMS
Metal monsters, they’re ripping us to shreds!
Get out of the asteroid belt, it’s a trap —
. hull integrity’s down to twelve per cent, we can’t —
Half the fleet’s on fire, and the rest are —
[Repeat,] steer clear of the asteroids, they’re mined with magnetic [bombs —]
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION, ANOTHER SCREAM
Oh God, here they come again! Here they [come —]
FX: SOUND OF WEAPONS FIRE, IMPACTS, EXPLOSIONS
Get out! Save yourselves! For God’s sake, [get out —]
FX: STATIC FLOODS THE RADIO
Turn it off, Khan.
Lieutenant—?
Turn it off!
(FX: A BLEEP SILENCES THE STATIC. DISTANT CRUMP OF EXPLOSIONS
AUDIBLE IN BACKGROUND)
(STUNNED) The Tarawera, the Helena, the Fisk — all gone.
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION. LOUDER, CLOSER
(MURMURED) And there goes the Ashburton.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 3
Hospital ships? They’re attacking hospital ships-?!?
Standard operating procedure: once you’ve eliminated the strongest threats, move on to weaker targets.
(FX: BUTTONS) We should move in closer. Some of the fleet must have jettisoned life pods.
No.
But we should be searching for survivors —
I said no, Sergeant! The enemy doesn’t leave survivors. Besides, we've already sustained too much damage ourselves.
We've got to do something!
FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION, CLOSE ENOUGH TO RATTLE FILLINGS
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 4
2. INT. DALEK COMMAND SHIP (BRIDGE
(FX: AMBIENT ENGINE NOISE. DISTANT CRUMP OF EXPLOSIONS. DOOR
OPEN. BLACK DALEK ENTERS )
1: Black Dalek on bridge.
Report!
1: Seventy-three per cent of enemy fleet destroyed. Sixteen per cent [disabled —]
2: Alert! Sensors detect mass exodus of escape craft!
Despatch Dalek patrols to exterminate them!
2: I obey!
(FX: STATIC — TUNING IN) [This is] Lieutenant Beth Stokes to Dalek command vessel. Come in, please —
1: Human communications signal incoming.
They want to surrender. Open response channel.
FX: A CLICK. STATIC CUTS OUT
Repeat. This is Lieutenant Beth Stokes to Dalek command vessel
Speak!
This — this fleet is made up of civilian transports, not military targets. You must break off your attack immediately.
Why?
They’re carrying refugees! Non-combatants! They’re no threat to you!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003
All humans are the enemy of the Daleks.
Show some mercy!
Mercy? There is no value in mercy.
No value-?!?
Close communications channel!
FX: CLICK. STATIC RESUMES
Continue the attack!
- AB)
Page 5
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 6
3. INT. HUMAN ESCORT SHIP (COCKPIT
FX: AMBIENT NOISE AS BEFORE, WITH STATIC AND EXPLOSIONS
Get us away from here, Khan.
You can’t abandon the fleet.
There is no fleet, not anymore. What’s the nearest human outpost?
FX: COMPUTER BLEEPS
A scientific research facility — Roarke Two-Seven-Nine.
Make best speed for it.
We should be fighting the enemy, not running away-!
Don’t question my orders, Sergeant. Just get us out of here!
FX: ENGINES ROAR INTO LIFE. STATIC AND EXPLOSIONS FADE
4. INT. DALEK COMMAND SHIP (BRIDGE
FX: AMBIENT NOISE, AS BEFORE. EXPLOSIONS IN BACKGROUND
1: Enemy fighter escaping!
2: Should I despatch patrols to intercept?
No. Let them run. The humans will seek refuge with their own kind — and lead us to our next target!
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 7
5. EXT. BLISS (HILLTOP
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS
(TAKEN ABACK) ‘Bliss’?
Yeah, right.
(FX: CLOSING DOOR) Bliss. A rare sanctuary for flora and fauna in a galaxy riven by war.
Like the Galapagos Islands, you said. So what’s with all the creepy grey trees covered in thorns bigger than my face?
(SNIFFING AIR) And what’s with the stink of — I don’t know, what is that?
Burnt silk? Yes. Burnt silk and static electricity.
What’s wrong with this picture? Professor?
If this is paradise, (CHEESY GAMESHOW HOST) “I’‘1l take the bag!”
Come again?
You’ve never seen It’s In The Bag? Best game show ever, bar none. Loads of great catchphrases too.
Must have been after my time —
(IRRITATION) Yes yes yes. Ace, Hex — this is all beside the point.
You’re sure we’ve landed in the right place, Doctor?
This is indeed the planet Bliss. But something’s terribly wrong here.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 8
(SARCASTIC) So, everyone back to the TARDIS, then?
Yes, that might be wise. (FX: OPENING DOOR) In you both go.
Sorry?
You're kidding, right?
It’ll be safer if you remain in the TARDIS.
Come off it. What’s going on?
This isn’t your problem, either of you. But I’m making it mine. I’ll be back soon. (FX: WALKS AWAY)
(CALLING AFTER) Back from where? Professor-!
This is so weird. He never tells us to stay in the TARDIS.
No, he doesn’t. Not unless things are really, really bad.
Maybe it’s a double bluff. He’s telling us to stay here because he really wants us to go with him?
You really think he’d be that manipulative?
Like you don’t-?
(FX: CLOSING DOOR) Fair point. Come on, you. (RUNNING) Doctor!
(RUNNING) Wait for us!
Just don’t say I didn’t warn you!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 9
6. INT. HUMAN ESCORT SHIP (COCKPIT
FX: ROARING OF ENGINES IN BACKGROUND
(ABOVE ENGINE NOISE) How much further, Khan?
(DITTO) Breaking atmos now. Roarke Two-Seven-Nine’s on the far Side of the planet.
Fuel status?
Enough to get us there, but no further. Shaking off the Daleks burned through our reserves.
Better that than having them on our tail. Take us down.
FX: ENGINE SOUNDS DROP IN PITCH, FADE DOWN
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 10
7. EXT. BLISS (FOREST
(WALKING, CALLING AHEAD) Not too far, Ace-!
(OFF) Yeah, yeah, yeah —
(WALKING WITH DOCTOR) Here, Doctor, what are all these grey trees?
If I didn’t know better, I’d say they were ironweed, Hex.
Iron what?
Ironweed — a pernicious plant that feeds on other vegetation. Normally grows to the length of your arm.
But these trees are twenty, thirty foot high...
Yes. (STOPPING) Noticed anything else about them?
(STOPPED) They’re all in rows. Like — a plantation.
Evidence of intent, of planning — of industrialisation, even. All things that shouldn’t happen on Bliss.
Why would someone create an ironweed forest?
The species is unique: it has mercury for sap.
These thorns are amazing. Like swords, or something —
Hex, don’t touch —
Owww! It’s sliced me hand open!
Let me see —
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB)
(WINCING) Well, scratched it. I know, I know. You’ve million times, don’t exaggerate. Oww!
My handkerchief, Hex —
Yeah, I’m not crying.
To bind it?
Oh, right. Cheers —
Doctor! Hex! You’d better come and look at this!
Now what-?
(RUSHING OFF) Hurry up, Hex!
FX: CROSS TO:
Page 11
told me a
(CALLING) I said, you’d better come and look at [this-]
ARRIVING) Yes, yes, we heard — (SEEING DEAD BODIES
What d’you reckon did this-?
(ARRIVING) Oh my God. Oh, horrible —
Oh.
Yeah, it’s not like you haven’t seen dead bodies before —
Death hasn’t lost its power to appal our friend. That’s not a
bad thing, Ace.
How many-?
I count at least a dozen. What’s left of them. Most of their
clothes have been shredded.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 12
So have the bodies!
There’s a few bits of material left. Some numbers here: two,
seven, nine...
A lab coat. This one was a physician.
Or a nurse.
Yes. Clustered together, as if they were driven here.
Herded?
Then the attack came.
All this blood... They must’ve still been alive, even after —
Now do you see why I wanted you both to stay in the TARDIS?
What the hell’s going on here, Doctor?
FX: A HEAVY, MUFFLING THUDDING NOISE APPROACHES
Everybody — down!
(FX: THE NOISE ZOOMS OVERHEAD, THE DOPPLER EFFECT CHANGING THE
AS THE SOURCES PASSES ABOVE THEM)
A spaceship!
Military markings — it’s an escort fighter. Strictly short range.
FX: ENGINE NOISE FADES INTO DISTANCE
How'd it get here, then?
How indeed?
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 13
8. EXT. ROARKE 279 FACILITY
(FX: ESCORT COMES IN TO LAND, ITS THUDDING ENGINE EASING TO A HALT. WIND GUSTS AS A DOOR WHIRRS OPEN)
FX: FOOTSTEPS AS BETH AND KHAN EXIT ESCORT SHIP RAMP
I’1l make contact with the facility staff. Khan, fall out the troops and take a roll call, then get the wounded to the infirmary for treatment. Oh, and activate all comms units.
Yes, Ma’am.
(FX: KHAN STOMPS UP RAMP INTO SHIP. BETH’S FOOTSTEPS CROSS GRAVEL, STOP. MEEEEEEP )
Who’s there?
Lieutenant Beth Stokes, Valkyrie Unit Echo Three Six. Requesting permission to enter this facility.
Impossible. Our next military inspection’s not due for months
It’s a medical emergency, not an inspection. Identify yourself!
Professor Toshio Shimura. Sorry, lieutenant, but I can’t allow you inside — parts of the facility are under quarantine.

You misunderstand, Professor — asking for permission was a courtesy, nothing more. Roarke Two-Seven-Nine is funded by the military. My troops need treatment, and our ship needs refuelling. You will let us in, or suffer the consequences.
FX: A BEAT, JUST GUSTS OF WIND AUDIBLE. EVENTUALLY...
Very well.
FX: LOCK CLUNKS OPEN. DOOR SLIDES ASIDE
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 14
9. EXT. BLISS (FOREST
Hex, I want you back inside the TARDIS. You too, Ace.
No way.
You need us.
Not this time. Better if neither of you gets involved.
FX: A FAINT, ANGRY HUMMING BECOMES AUDIBLE IN BACKGROUND
You said it yourself, Doctor — something’s terribly wrong
here. We can help you put things right.
Don’t be so sure about that.
At least let us try.
I need equipment from the TARDIS to analyse these wound patterns. We can debate our next move on the way —
FX: THE HUMMING IS LOUDER, BUZZING MIXED INTO IT
Er, what’s that-?
What’s what?
I dunno. Humming.
Look up.
A — cloud?
A swarm.
Oh great.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 15
What are they? Hornets?
Not in this galaxy, Ace.
Then [what-?]
Piranha locusts.
Not a name that inspires confidence.
Don’t tell me — they’re what happened to those people back there?
I’m afraid so.
FX: BUZZING CLOSER
Look at the size of them-!
Four or five times larger than normal. I wonder what’s made these specimens so big?
Not sure this is the time for scientific curiosity.
Nonsense, there’s always time for scientific curiosity.
Oh God — they’re coming this way!
You were saying, Doctor?
Sometimes the need for speed outweighs even my curiosity.
In other words-?
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 16
10. INT. CORRIDOR
FX: FOOTSTEPS OF TWO PEOPLE WALKING
Forgive my earlier abruptness, Lieutenant. Your sudden arrival took me by surprise.
This facility can support forty people when fully staffed. Where are all the others, Professor?
Most were evacuated when war spilled into this sector. Then the infection swept through those who stayed behind...
Infection?
A virus, most likely alien in origin. We put the victims into isolation, sealed off their quarters. A few are still alive. I was fortunate, in that I seem to have some sort of natural immunity.
That doesn’t explain why you didn’t join the evacuation.
My work is here. I couldn’t abandon a lifetime of research and testing, not when I’m so close to completion.
What is this project?
Sorry, but you don’t have security clearance for that.
Well, once my troops are patched up and our ship’s refuelled, we'll be evacuating you to the nearest military base.
(STOPPED) You can’t make me leave.
(STOPPED) Professor, listen to me. The Daleks will have control of this sector within days, if not sooner. Either you come with us, or you’ll die here.
I’d rather die than leave my work.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 17
I’m not threatening you, Professor. Simply stating facts.
If Daleks do not frighten me, Lieutenant — what chance have you got? (FX: WALKS AWAY)
(CALLING AFTER) Professor. Professor-!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 18
11. EXT. BLISS (FOREST
FX: ANGRY BUZZ OF PIRANHA LOCUSTS, GETTING CLOSER
(RUNNING) The swarm — it’s gaining on us!
(RUNNING) I know!
(RUNNING) We can’t out-run them forever!
(RUNNING) I know!
(RUNNING) So? What we gonna do?
(RUNNING) Keep running!
(RUNNING) That’s your plan — keep running?
(RUNNING) Not far now!
(RUNNING) Where to?
(RUNNING) Up ahead! That building!
(RUNNING) What building-?
(RUNNING) That building, Hex!
FX: THEY RUN OUT OF EARSHOT
FX: ANGRY BUZZ GETS LOUDER, BEFORE SURGING PAST. FADES DOWN
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 19
12. INT. INFIRMARY
FX: AMBIENT HUMAN OF MACHINERY. LIFE SUPPORT SYSTEMS BEEP
FX: AUTOMATED DOOR SLIDES OPEN. FOOTSTEPS ENTER
Who are you?
FX: WHIRR AS MEDIC DROID APPROACHES BETH
Lieutenant Stokes. These are my troops. Who are you?
Sistermatic, the medical droid. This is my infirmary.
I need everyone prepped for evacuation within the hour.
Impossible. Three of your troopers should not have survived the journey here. Moving them again would certainly be fatal.
What about the others?
Seven I would classify as walking wounded. I was busy treating them when you interrupted me.
For a standard medical droid, you’re a real pain in the backside-!
Displays of anger can be symptomatic of underlying psychological conditions. Have you considered a course of counselling?
I’m asking the questions! Professor Shimura said you had
patients in an isolation unit — where is it?
Over here.
FX: SISTERMATIC WHIRRS AWAY. FOOTSTEPS FOLLOW
FX: MEEP BLEEP ON KEY PAD
This door’s sealed.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 20
It was necessary to stop the contagion spreading.
You locked them away...?
It was necessary to stop the contagion spreading.
FX: BURST OF STATIC
Lieutenant, it’s Khan. I’m at the facility command centre.
You’d better get up here.
On my way!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 21
13. EXT. ROARKE 279 FACILITY
FX: HEX AND ACE RUN INTO EARSHOT, GASPING FOR BREATH, STOP
(RUNNING TO HALT) What is this place-?
I don’t care. Entrance-?
This it-?
You think-?
(FX: BARGING DOOR) No use. It’s shut tight!
Here, let the grown-up have a go. (FX: SCRATCHING METAL) Yeah. Electromagnetic seal.
So-?
So we make some noise. (FX: ACE BANGS HER FISTS ON THE DOOR) Hey! Open up! Open up-!!!
FX: THE DOCTOR RUNS INTO EARSHOT, BREATHING HEAVY
Doctor, what we do?
(FX: FURIOUS THUMPING) I said, open up!!!
You’ve not got super powers, Ace. You can’t punch your way through reinforced plasteen.
Then what-?
Intercom-?
Intercom?
Use — the — intercom!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 22
The buzzer, like. Can’t think how we missed it. (FX: HEX
INTERCOM — MEEP!) Hello? Anyone there?
(INTO INTERCOM) Let us in!
(INTO INTERCOM) Please?
FX: PROLONGED MEEEEEEEEP. ANGRY SWARM BUZZ BECOMES AUDIBLE
The swarm’s nearly on us-!
Sixty seconds away. Maybe less.
FX: ANGRY BUZZING GETS LOUDER. CLOSER
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 23
14. INT. COMMAND CENTRE
(FX: STRIDING IN) What is it, Khan?
Security feed from the northeast entrance. (FX: BLEEP) We’ve got visitors.
(FX: SCANNER DISTORT. BANGING ON DOOR) Someone open this door right now or I'll —
(D) What? What’1ll you do, exactly?
(D) Please —
DOCTOR/ACE/HEX: (D)_.. open the door!!!
Who the hell are they? Can’t be refugees, not after what happened to the fleet. Unless...
Lieutenant?
There were rumours about the Daleks using replicants to infiltrate our forces, sabotage the war effort.
These three look real enough to me.
Let’s find out. (FX: BLEEP) (INTO MIC) Identify yourselves.
Ssh ssh ssh, I heard —
Repeat, identify yourselves!
Me name’s Hex, this is the Doctor and that’s Ace!
Our names don’t matter — just open this door!
Not until you identify yourselves.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 24
You mad? There’s a swarm of piranha locusts about to eat us alive out here, and you want I.D.?
Probably thinks you don’t look eighteen.
Oh, ha ha.
Hold on.
You hold on —
FX: BEEP AS BETH SILENCES AUDIO
Piranha locusts?
Security scans show a swarm of insects approaching that location.
Can we activate the perimeter security grid?
Not with those three outside. They’1ll be cut to ribbons.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 25
15. EXT. ROARKE 279 FACILITY
FX: SWARM BUZZING
Unbelievable. She put us on hold!
Let me try. (FX: MEEEEP) Under the terms of the Protocols of Sanctuary, I demand that you let us in —
FX: BURST OF STATIC
You’re in no position to demand [anything —] What ‘Protocols of Sanctuary’?
I just made them up. Identify yourself, soldier!
Made them up-?
I said, identify yourself!
Lieutenant Beth Stokes, Valkyrie Unit Echo Three Six.
Doctor, the swarm-!
Ace —
What-?
Don’t suppose you’d want to —
No —
. say a prayer with me, like?
Lieutenant Stokes, open this door or you’ll face a severe reprimand when your commanding officer hears about this!
I can’t —
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David
You can, and you will!
FX: SWARM BUZZ MUCH LOUDER NOW
(TO HEX) I — I dunno.
(003 - AB) Page 26
(TO HEX) Just because. It doesn’t have to mean anything.
FX: CLUNK-THUNK AS DOOR UNLOCKS
Thank God —
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN
Thank Lieutenant Stokes.
Just get in! In-!!!
FX: SWARM BUZZ OVERWHELMS ALL OTHER SOUNDS
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB)
16. INT. ROARKE 279 ENTRANCE
FX: DOORS CLUNK SHUT, CUTTING OUT SWARM BUZZ) (BEAT
That was too close.
Can’t believe that Lieutenant wasn’t gonna let us in.
She’s afraid.
Why? She hasn’t met us yet.
Doctor, how’d you even know this place was here?
Lucky guess.
Yeah, right.
Be fair, that fighter was coming in to land —
FX: TWO SETS OF RUNNING FOOTSTEPS APPROACH
(TO BETH & KHAN) Good afternoon.
FX: TWO PULSE RIFLES CHARGE UP, READY TO FIRE
Stay where you are!
FX: RUNNING CEASES
I do love a warm welcome.
Shame we never get one.
Silence!
Who are you people? What are you doing here?
Page 27
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 28
That’s a bit hard to explain —
. seeing as how your Sergeant just told us to be silent, like.
Answer the question!
I’ve already said. I’m the Doctor, and these are my friends
Ace —
Hello.
. and Hex.
Alright?
What are you doing here?
We came to help.
You’re not soldiers.
No, although Ace has been known to lob
Just in my spare time.
And Hex is an experienced nurse.
the occasional grenade.
Some dressing you’ve got on that leg, Sergeant...?
Khan. Tahira Khan.
Been in the wars, yeah?
Literally. Lieutenant, you’re part of a Valkyrie Unit?
Yes.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 29
Never heard of them.
An all-female fighting force created to combat the most dangerous, most malevolent alien species ever to attack mankind —
Ohh no. Don’t say it.
Say what?
What he’s about to say.
What’s he about to say-?
. Daleks.
Great.
We should have left these three outside, Lieutenant —
Silence, all of you! (BEAT) This facility’s being evacuated. Suggest you return to your ship and leave. Immediately.
Bit tricky, what with those piranha locusts outside.
How about we stay here, help you evacuate?
Many hands make light work.
FX: MEEP, BEEP, BEEP
Scanner says they’re — oh.
Two human, one not. But all lacking the tell-tale carbon Signature of the Dalek replication process.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB)
What’s your field, Doctor? Medicine?
The sciences, mainly.
Good. Perhaps you can make Professor
Shimura? Professor Toshio Shimura?
You know him?
Only by reputation.
Shimura see sense.
Now’s your chance to meet him. Follow me!
FX: BETH MARCHES AWAY, FOLLOWED BY DOCTOR
Us too-?
You too. Move-!
Page
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 31
17. INT. DALEK COMMAND SHIP (BRIDGE
FX: AMBIENT HUM OF ENGINES. SCANNERS BEEP
Report!
2: We are in orbit above the target.
Begin surface scans.
FX: OSCILLATING DRONE BEGINS
1: Long-range sensors ineffective. Atmospheric anomalies are blocking our systems.
Launch sub-orbital patrol to investigate the planetoid’s surface. Any humans found are to be subjugated or exterminated!
1 & 2: We obey!
FX: DALEKS GLIDE AWAY
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 32
18. INT. CORRIDOR
FX: MULTIPLE SETS OF FOOTSTEPS APPROACH
‘Daleks’, huh?
Yeah. You know how the TARDIS is your passport to a lifetime of adventure and excitement in time and space-?
Yeah —
They’re the catch.
The Daleks are a race of vicious, relentless machine creatures.
What, like the Cybermen?
Worse.
You never said, either of you. Never said a word.
sorry.
The Daleks tear apart entire solar systems, much like the piranha locusts did to those bodies in the forest.
FX: FOOTSTEPS SLOW, AND STOP
Bodies? What are you talking about?
We found twelve corpses outside, all of them eaten alive.
Do the numbers two, seven and nine have any significance here?
This facility is called Roarke Two-Seven-Nine.
Those numbers were on the dead people’s clothing.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 33
What was left of them.
But Professor Shimura told me half his colleagues were evacuated. An infection claimed most of the others.
Any survivors?
In an isolation unit, at the infirmary.
Funny he didn’t mention the dead bodies outside.
Hilarious.
If what you’re saying is true, the Professor has a lot of questions to answer. Perhaps you can help us get to the truth.
FX: FOOTSTEPS RESUME
Doctor? What is it, what’s wrong?
I should have insisted you two stay in the TARDIS.
Why? You know what’s going on here, don’t you?
No, not for certain — not yet. But I have my suspicions.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 34
19. INT. LABORATORY
FX: AMBIENT SOUND — A SOFT, GENTLE DRONE
FX: SCRITCH, SCRATCH — METAL ON METAL
Time for the final infusion...
FX: SCRITCH!
Forgive me. It hurts, I know, but all births are painful.
(FX: FRENZIED SCRAPING, JAGGED, SHARP. HISS OF AN AUTO- SYRINGE)
FX: METAL SOUNDS BECOME MORE FRENETIC
FX: THEN THE SCRAPING EASES, REPLACED BY A NEW SOUND
FX: A HEARTBEAT, ALMOST HUMAN
There. It is begun.
FX: SCRATCH. SCRATCH
Shall I sing a lullaby, to soothe you back to sleep?
FX: A SINGLE, LONG SCRATCH
A lullaby it is...
(SAKURA, SAKURA IS A JAPANESE FOLK SONG, IN THE PUBLIC DOMAIN — SINGING CONTINUES UNTIL NOTED BELOW — THE DOCTOR NEEDS TO HEAR THE PHRASE ‘SAKURA, SAKURA’ )
Sakura, sakura, no-yama mo sato mo, mi-watasu kagiri, kasumi ka kumo ka, asahi ni niou, sakura, sakura —
FX: INTERCOM BLEEEP SOUNDS OVER THE TOP OF SHIMURA SINGING
Open the lab door, Professor.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 35
FX: FRENZY OF SCRATCHING AND SCRITCHING
SHIMURA STOPS SINGING
Hush yourself, hush. I’1l1 be right back.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 36
20. INT. CORRIDOR
(INTO INTERCOM) I said, come out of there!
The Professor seems reluctant to put in an appearance.
The Professor is a pain in the —
FX: INTERCOM BLEEP
I can’t leave my experiment unattended. It’s at a crucial stage.
That can wait. I need answers, Professor.
Just — leave me in peace.
FX: INTERCOM BLEEPS OFF
Nice fella. Really friendly.
Khan — get this door open.
FX: MEEP BLEEP
He’s encrypted the lock. Take hours to over-ride —
FX: OVERWHELMING SQUALL OF STATIC BURSTS FROM INTERCOM
What the-?
What’s that sound?
The beginning of the end!
What?
Or perhaps the end of the beginning!
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB)
& HEX (SHOUTING): What?!?
FX: STATIC CUTS OUT
That’s a relief. What’s he playing at-?
That wasn’t the Professor’s work.
Then whose was it-?
Attention. Attention-!
Oh, no...
Page 37
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 38
21. INT. LABORATORY

elements.text: PART TWO
REPRISE:
One of the worst atrocities committed during the Dalek wars happens at this research facility. Here. Now.
You mean those bodies we found outside?
They’re just the tip of the iceberg.
What kind of atrocity?
The sort I never wanted either of you to witness. I’m sorry.
So we’re here to stop the atrocity, is that it?
You couldn’t be further from the truth.
Stop talking in riddles, Doctor!
I’m not on Bliss to prevent the atrocity. I’m here to make sure it happens!
23. INT. CORRIDOR (CONTINUED
What is this atrocity? What happens here?
I can’t tell you that.
Can’t — or won’t?
Very little will ever be made public about what’s happening here on Bliss. I’ve got a role to play in all of this, but you two —
We were meant to stay in the TARDIS.
ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB)
Precisely.
Page 43
We can’t go back now, even if we wanted to — not with those
piranha locusts outside.

FX: ANOTHER MASSIVE EXPLOSION — MUFFLED, BUT CLOSER

FX: ANOTHER EXPLOSION — ALMOST ON TOP OF THEM

Lieutenant Stokes!
Sorry, I was just.. What is it, Sergeant?
FX: DISTANT EXPLOSION

ENEMY OF THE DALEKS by David Bishop (003 - AB) Page 45
They’1ll be coming for us soon. No faces, no souls, nothing you can reason with. Just metal.
You’ve fought the Daleks before?
Only in battle sims.
Then how-?
They attacked the colony where I grew up. Subjugated the people, strip-mined the planet. Tore us apart, like wet paper.
Sorry, Ma’am. I didn’t know.
If we’re lucky, the Daleks have orders to exterminate us. A bright light, a few moments of searing pain — and then nothing.
And if we’re unlucky...?
They’1ll be taking prisoners, to be interred as potential slave labour.
We'd live to fight another day.

But we’ve only seen Stokes and her sergeant so far.
Precisely.
Their escort fighter looked pretty banged up. You don’t get that much damage without sustaining casualties.
Where are the others, then?
I think we should visit the infirmary. Coming, Ace?
I’m heading for the command centre, see if I can help there.
Stay in touch.
Copy that.

It was necessary to stop the contagion spreading.
